text: Absolutely pleased with services received from John Burns Estate & Elder Care Law firm. Mr. Burns and his staff are caring, concerned, involved, and proactive. I know every situation is unique, but our outcome was positive. I attribute our success to the effectiveness of John Burns and his staff!

text: John burns  was such a huge help for me dealing with Medicaid. He is a down to earth guy that doesn't talk over your head when explaining how things work. Highly recommended him.

name: Lee Smith
text: Mr. Burns was able to explain what we needed to do clearly and in a manner that helped my elderly parents feel at ease.

name: Amy McWilliams
text: Incredibly thankful that a friend recommended Rebecca Winters to us. She is professional, responsive, and knowledgeable. Truly cares about her clients and works hard on your behalf.

name: william thompson
text: If you're looking for an attorney that is trust worthy and will fight for you. You cant go wrong with Ms. Winters. She is awesome. I cant put in to words how much she means to me and my children. If not for her I'd be a weekend dad. Rebecca fought for me. She doesn't do it for the money. She does it because she cares.

name: Stephen Rice
text: I selected Rebecca and her firm to handle my divorce. She is very attentive to details, thorough in explaining things to me, and offers a communication process that is convenient and quick. I am very happy that she was referred to me and I definitely recommend her if you need a family law or divorce attorney.

name: Brittany Brown
text: Very disappointed in how Rebecca handled my adoption case. Took multiple emails to get any sort of response from her. If I tried calling her voicemail box was always full. Communication was awful and then making false promises that she didn’t follow through with when she had to transfer my case. Can not recommend.

name: Brandi Wilson
text: Rebecca Winters is helping with my divorce. From the first day she helped me feel more confident, rather than ashamed. I recommend her to everyone in need of a Family Law Lawyer.

name: ryane goyette
text: Extremely proffesional yet constantly keeps the best interest of both the children and her client. Very compassionate loving and atentive, i would strongly recommend rebecca to anyone in these unfortunate situations for guidance, legal council and a will to see justice to its fullest

text: The only reason I gave a one is because you had to in order to leave a review. Well we tried to let him do a suing case and he asked us to call the insurance company and to go fix our totaled car so therefor i hired another lawyer on it we had a criminal case this morning that he was suppose to be at the last hearing and he didn't show up so  if you want this lawyer you best be ready to do the work yourself and pay out the butt to him

Should you ever need legal services, I highly recommend Whitten Law Firm.  Definitely one of the best!  Shirley Mills

name: Ginger Lewis
text:
Mr. Randy Whitten is the best attorney I have ever had the pleasure of doing business with. His office lady, Whitney, is just the sweetest girl. They both are so passionate about making sure you are taking care of, they keep you up to date about everything going on in your case.
I will never use another attorney. They are such a professional and great team together.

text: Ray Kennington handled our child custody suit and I was never concerned about the quality of services I was getting. I would recommend him to anyone. In fact, I already have.

name: Michelle Campbell
text: I met with Mr. Grainger today and I feel relieved!! The professionalism started with Tammy telling me everything is going to be okay and that things are fixable! Mr. Grainger is extremely professional, honest, and his Christian values left me feeling at peace! I’m thankful to the Grainger Law Firm because of their expertise and compassion! I have peace of mind knowing there’s a plan of action! Thank you for all of your help!!

resp.text: I appreciate your kind words. If you need anything, please don't hesitate to contact myself or my staff. We are here to serve and and help any way that we can. Thank you again!

name: Johndara Green
text: Wonderful staff excellent service's I truly recommend them they don't just take your case to make money they look at it give you their honest opinion

resp.text: Thanks! Stop by anytime for a chat!

name: Kevin Raymond Allen Mullens
text: Mr. Grainger and his staff are truely amazing. They are very responsive and everyone was very professional. They make sure your comfortable explain all your options and keep you informed throughout the entire 5+ year process. Melanie, Barbara, Ann, And Mr.Grainger are top Notch and are like a big happy family. Not one time did I ever feel like a number or just a client they treat you like part of the family which is rare these days even received a call from Ann Friday evening letting me know my case was paid off and she was preparing the discharge motions. Like I said you would be informed every step of the way and they go above and beyond to get you the best possible outcome in your situation! To the entire staff at Grainger legal services thank you for keeping me encouraged throughout this tough five years. Although I no my case is about to close I have made friends for a lifetime. If your in need of an attorney you would be in very good hands to reach out to Mr.Grainger.

name: Robert Skeen
text: If you need a lawyer go see Mr. Grainer he will fix you up

resp.text: Greatly appreciated. Thank you sir!

text:
To all of the Lawyers and Staff Members
The services received from this firm was more than I could hope to imagine.
There is now a calmness after the storm.
I will continue to recommend the professional and qualified services given by each of the staff.
Their warmth and patience is received from the front desk and carried through out the entire firm.
Thank you for this opportunity to say what I feel about this firm and all the staff.

Marsha Van Diver
Client

text:
I remember leaving the consolation and feeling relieved to hear our options. It was as if a heavy weight was lifted.
Grainger Legal Services are in my opinion, “professional and knowledgeable”.

Wendy Higby

name: Amy Lawrence McMullen
text: Mr. Grainger and his staff (especially Susan) are friendly and welcoming. They treated us with respect and they went above and beyond our expectations. We highly recommend thier services. You cannot go wrong with Grainger Legal Services, LLC.

name: Brittany Bibb
text: Mr. Grainger and staff are very caring, understanding, and wonderful. They explain everything to you so you will understand. Thank you for everything you all are the best.

name: Faron Jones
text: Did a wonderful job, very helpful and work with me during the processing of my case.  Will most definitely, will highly recommend Grainger Legal Services.  If I can rate the service higher than 5 I will.  Special thanks to Grainger Legal Services and staff.  Especially Barbara the paralegal.

name: Linda Nobles
text: Great legal services. Nice workers. Very friendly   people

name: jennifer pike
text: They are great! If you need advice call them. They will help you understand all options you have.

resp.text: Your feedback is greatly appreciated!

name: Kaneisha Brundidge
text: I just left from having a consultation with this law firm. I thought that I was meeting with Mr. Grainger but he had a dental appointment to get to. Instead I met with Hayden Sneed, his partner. Terrible person!!! His demeanor was horrible and if I was not a Christian, I would have let him have it. He showed no interest in helping me whatsoever. He talked to me as if I wasn't educated or even had any bit of sense. I even mentioned to him his demeanor and the way he talked to was was horrible. I chose to seek help here due to their reviews, but have been misled. They wouldn't have gotten one star from me, but I have to rate them to leave a review. After about 10 minutes, I concluded this was not the place for me. Choose someone else to represent you.

resp.text: Ms. Reynolds, we’re sorry we did not meet your expectations.  Many law firms have more than one attorney, and our small firm is no different. Our appointments usually last at least 30 minutes, which allows the attorney to go over the legal options that fit the client’s situation, needs, goals, and expectations.  Keeping an open mind when you meet with a lawyer is the best way to get the most out of your meeting.  Coming into that meeting dead-set against an idea is a sure-fire recipe for disaster.  We regret that we were unable to represent Ms. Reynolds, but her goals and expectations were not achievable through the avenue she wanted to pursue. We fight for our clients every day and pride ourselves in making sure our clients receive legal representation and advice that meets and exceeds their expectations, and we feel the rest of our Google reviews strongly reflect this.

name: Eddie Langford
text: Great place to get legal help

name: Ashley “Monkey” Delrie
text: It was quick and they are all nice and explain everything very well and give you different options to go by to better suit your financial situation.... they helped me do what I needed quick like and simple.... thank you very much.... keep up all the smiles and great attitude... I greatly appreciate it...i dont know how to make a new one but i just wanted to say thank all of you for everthing yall have done i am in good hands and thank yall for making it happened yall have the kindness people working there and i aprricated all of yall for making it happen

resp.text: You are very welcome! We are here to serve!

text: They were very helpful with me getting information on what I needed to do

text: Great people and friendly staff!

text: They have gone above and beyond to help me and work with me

resp.text: We do our best to try to get people out of the hole. Working with you was a pleasure and I hope you are doing well.

name: Tawanda Rhymes
text: This is a great establishment

name: Gihon
text: Kisha Abercrombie is an amazing, well read attorney. Highly recommend her for any criminal case.

name: Catherine Griffin
text:
They just don't come better than Trip Walton and the Walton Law Firm. Your best interest is their top priority. HANDS DOWN!

Professionalism from start to finish, always keeping you in the loop.

Trip is absolutely one of the best lawyers I have ever met, if not THEE best. A unique things about Trip Walton is that he never loses touch with the human side of his case or his clients. He has the best stories to tell and his laugh is contagious. But when it comes to business, he's so knowledgeable and informed, that one would think he wrote the book on  the law in Alabama.

My case is over, but I feel like I gained a friend for life. Thank you Trip! God bless you and your family!

resp.text: Thank you very much for your detailed feedback Catherine! Very glad to see that you are happy with the outcome of your case. Our entire team at Walton Law Firm is dedicated to providing the best experience for every single one of our clients. I will be sure to pass on your feedback to Mr. Walton!

name: Linda Powell
text: When i meet  with them they give me all the ways they were going to do, which was good even about a trail .then later on they turn  on me. I paid them, but for what.

name: Yanan Duan
text: Walton Law Firm was very helpful. I highly recommend them to the ones who need legal aid. They are experts in dealing with my case. I believe. Because they try their best to protect my interest. And the result is unexpectedly good. My attorney Mallory who is very nice and very familiar with law and each process in my case. She always helped me and answered each question I had. They negotiated with medical agencies, other litigant insurance company and obtained evidence. Mallory analyzed my case wisely and gave the most effective method to protect my interest. They did all they could to fright for my right. It saved me a lot of time. I could spend all time in recovery. After that, I focused on study and didn’t need to pay too much attention on my case. It is the first time I cooperate with an attorney. I was very worried in the beginning and didn’t sure if they were experienced attorney or not. Now, I am sure the anxiety is absolutely unnecessary. All I need to do is trusting them, providing material I had. That’s all. All in all, they are experienced attorneys. I never feel regret to invite them to deal with my case and very satisfied with their help.

resp.text: Thank you very much for writing such a detailed account of your experience with our firm! We are dedicated to providing the utmost highest level of service and accountability to each of our clients. Our lawyers and staff refer to our clients by name with respect for their rights as human beings, not just another case number. We are very happy to help!

name: Colton Justice
text: At Walton Law firm I didn’t have to choose between hiring a firm who’s name carries weight and influence, and having an attorney who would have the time to be invested in me and will fight for me. They have a proven track record and stellar reputation in the courts, and they also take the time to get to know their clients and absolutely go to battle for them. Highly recommend.

resp.text: Everyone here at Walton Law Firm is very appreciative of your review and the trust your put in our firm! We are committed to providing the utmost highest level of service and accountability to each of our clients.

name: Angel Johnson
text: I absolutely love Trip and his entire staff! Everyone has always been super nice and extremely helpful. They handled EVERYTHING  for me, I can't imagine going through that life changing event without Trip &  staff by my side. I will ALWAYS keep them on speed dial. They are definitely 5 star all the way in my book!

resp.text: We will be sure Mr. Walton receives your compliments! Thank you so much for taking time out of your busy day to leave us such a great review!

name: brian ross
text:
I was visiting my family in Alabama when I was suddenly stopped by a an officer for speeding. I didn't agree with the ticket as the speedfrom 55pmh to 45mph and I didn't realize it.  I initially called an attorney in Tuscaloosa that was specialized in fighting speeding tickets but he wasn't helpful. I then called Thanks Walton Law Firm and spoke with Frissee and let me tell you. She told me everything that would happen and it did swiftly. I honestly cannot thank her enough for the dedication and attentiveness all while being super professional. I would recommend anyone and I would even say that this is hands down the best firm in Alabama.  Go Walton Lawfirm!! Cheers Frissee!! :)

Brian Ross
Atlanta, GA

name: William Allanson
text: Trip Walton and all of his legal staff are excellent! The staff handled my case professionally and kept me up to pace with what was going on, from the first consultation to the end, I knew these guys were there to fight for me. I highly recommend this law firm to anyone seeking experienced, professional legal help.

resp.text: Thank you for your amazing review William! We are pleased you are happy with the outcome of your case!

name: Clint Niemeyer
text: It's most unfortunate when anyone has a personal injury due to an accident. Fortunately, those of us who have experienced such can take comfort in knowing that Trip and his seasoned, professional staff have our backs. Thanks a million, Trip, Mallory and all the staff at Walton Law Firm for a job well done!

resp.text: We really appreciate your kind words, Clint! Happy to see you were happy with the outcome of your case and will be sure to pass on your compliments to the Walton Law Firm team!

name: Rhonda Stoner
text: Kisha Abercrombie is a talented, hardworking, and compassionate attorney. She does her job and does it well. I highly recommend The Walton Law Firm and Kisha.

resp.text: Thanks Rhonda! This means a lot! We're happy to help in any way that we can at the Walton Law Firm.

name: dwight barnhart
text:
Run away.   For a traffic ticket they wanted $250 to sign you up for defensive driving.   Call the court.  They will do it for free.   They prey on people that want to clear their driving records.  So sorry people have to deal with this.  Alabama bar association should have hundreds of complaints against these people.

At least they will have one after today!!!   Along with the states attorney general.

Mr Kreps.   Thank you for your response.  And yes. We have both been able to generate public records at this along.  I won’t go to low and degrading levels implying that you have mental issues as you have done so.  I can see how your law firm works first and and responds to complaints by trying to belittle them on a public forum.  Is t it nice to be able to take pics of your responses off records before you edit them.

resp.text: We love all of our potential and current clients.  Everyone has the right to post something negative online so this is a safe space for you to vent.  I’ve been doing this for almost 20 years and have seen most everything and dealt with all different types of people.  We tried to reach out to you three times by telephone to figure out what it is that you were upset about but you refuse to answer the phone and actually talk to us.  I guess you are busy working on your complaint to the attorney general’s office and the Alabama State Bar (both of which we welcome you to file by the way - that is your right).  So, let me get this straight - you were visiting Alabama from Texas and you received a speeding ticket. You waited about a month and contacted our law firm to ask for help in handling the ticket.  We responded immediately, gave you the care and concern that you were seeking, went over the process with you and your options.  We quoted you a very reasonable fee and told you what we could do in order to resolve the case.  You told us that was too much and you were going to pay the ticket and move on - obviously that would not be based on our suggestion because we ALWAYS try to avoid a conviction for our clients (and we are a traffic ticket defense law firm... that you contacted for help).  Presumably, before you paid the ticket, you attempted to communicate on your own to try and get the ticket resolved (which every defendant out there has the right to do - only most people would do that first before contacting us but I guess that didn’t occur to you).  You then called us back and were upset because you resolved the ticket on your own…allegedly - after checking, it is clear that no resolution has been entered into the state system.  We love you man - but whatever it is that is troubling you has nothing to do with us - we hope you get whatever it is straightened out.  As for the frivolous complaints you have tried to threaten us with to the Alabama Attorney General’s office and the Alabama State Bar - bring it on.  We fight like hell for ourselves just like we fight like hell for our clients.  And another thing you may want to keep in mind - the goal of resolving a traffic ticket is so that you have no conviction and presumably no public record of it.  But, you sir, have done a great job of creating a public record of it for whatever reason and for the entire world to see.  Best of luck to you.  Joseph C. Kreps

name: Scott Zbaren
text: Kreps was able to get my speeding citation dismissed.  Process was pretty simple. They send you a checklist of what to do prior to the court date, they represent you in court, pay the court costs, and that’s it.  Communication was limited and only conducted when needed.  Cost me more than just paying the citation, but saved me from having points in my license.

name: Butch Pinkston
text:
Complete and utter waste of money.  After spending $500 with these hacks, I’m in a WORSE position than when I started.

The entire operation is run by a para-legal through text messages.  They promise everything but deliver nothing.  Total cookie-cutter law, no interest in actually defending a case.  I expect this kind of lying, duplicitous bull-sh*t from the cops and the government but not the people you pay good money to represent you.

resp.text:
* Thank you so much for your comments about my law firm - we certainly appreciate your comments and your feedback. We always love and enjoy any type of feedback. We ❤️public criticism of our firm because it allows others to see how we handle our business and how we respond and most of all, it causes us to step back and fully analyze a problem or situation to see what happened, where we can improve and it gives us a valuable opportunity to reach out to a client who is clearly hurting and offer support in whatever way we can.
The only issue in reaching out to you is that we do not know who you are and this is the first we have heard of any problem such as the one you describe - unfortunately, we do not currently have and have never had a client by the name of Butch Pinkston.  If I personally have an issue with a business, I usually contact the business directly and try to resolve whatever it is that is going on.  Businesses don’t get to make things up or hide behind fake names on the internet - I am as transparent as it gets and all of my actual clients know this.
*I have been practicing law for 16+ years and have successfully resolved 17,000+ charges for clients over that period of time.  I am a man - through and through - if someone has a problem with me, all they have to do is explain what the issue is and if I have made a mistake, then I am glad to admit the mistake, apologize and fix it.  That is the measure of a man.
Anyone that knows me and that I have helped knows that I am not a hack, a liar or deceitful - far from it.  If only a successful law practice could be run with a paralegal through text messages - but as you would know if we actually represented you, when someone hires us they are able to text us (and our clients LOVE this option), email us, they get a link to schedule an appointment (at a time convenient for the client) to talk with my staff, they also get a link to schedule an appointment (at a time convenient for the client) with an attorney and also, get our direct dial so all they have to do is call us with a question or issue or to schedule a call with anyone that works for me or an attorney (myself included).
* You don’t get to the level we are and have the impeccable reputation across Alabama and the country that I have by “promising everything but delivering nothing.”  Close to 100% of our charges we handle are ultimately dismissed - if that is “cookie-cutter law” then so be it.  Apparently, our clients love having their charges dismissed.  We have the utmost interest in defending cases - our actual clients know this.  Every single time we speak to a potential client or go over case resolutions with our clients, our goal is to develop options with the ultimate goal of having the charge(s) dismissed.  Once we have options on the table, we go over those options and our clients get to decide how to proceed - we don’t force anyone to accept any offer on the table and are always available to continue fighting, take the case to the next level or have a trial.  It is our client’s case and they get to decide.
* Wow - in your review you said, “I expect this kind of lying, duplicitous BS from the cops and the government but not the people you pay good money to represent you.”  Really?  You expect the cops and the government to lie?  What a sad, sad worldview you have - which explains the many false statements you made while hiding behind a fake name.  I practice law to relieve human suffering - period.  No other reason.  I love people - even the people that choose to post random diatribes attacking me on the internet.
*I invite anyone reading this or looking for a lawyer to Google my name (Joseph Kreps) and review the info about me and my law firm and all of the great work that we do throughout the State of Alabama for clients located all over the world.  I stand by my work and the work of everyone who is on my team.   Joseph C. Kreps * Alabama Lawyer * Lover of People * Defender of Human Beings

name: A Google User
text:
Where do I begin? I was arrested for DUI, Open Container, and speeding. I spent 10  hours in jail thinking my life would never be the same again once these charges  permanently stained my record. At first, I figured there was no point in hiring a lawyer  considering the fact that I was caught dead to rights. I was caught speeding. I was  caught with open container. I blew a .11 once I got to the station. What further proof  would they need to charge me with a DUI? How could I possibly get out of that? A  month went by and I still hadn't hired a lawyer. I got to thinking about it and I figured I  would try and find a good DUI attorney to at least provide some good advice before  entering my case single handedly. I then did some research, and happened to stumble  upon Attorney Joseph C Kreps' YouTube videos online that explained what would  happen if I were actually charged with these convictions. They were so enlightening that  I couldn't help but give this guy a call to see if he could help with my case. I gave him a  call & after getting my information & case details; one of the first things his secretary  mentioned was that they may be able to get the sentence reduced to a public  intoxication. I was astounded, thinking there's no way. I was caught dead to rights. I'm  going down. No doubt about it. I then decided to pay the fee and to hire Attorney Joseph  C Kreps' as my DUI Defense Lawyer (not NEAR as high as what I was quoted from  other firms). His very helpful team then guided me through the process of completing a  series of tasks that would help my case. I completed a questionnaire and a few other
simple tasks that would, in fact, turn out to help my case tremendously. A month later, I  was scheduled to arrive in court on a Wednesday. On a Monday afternoon prior to my  court date, I received a phone call that explained to me that I wouldn't need to show up  in court on Wednesday and that there was a high possibility that my case was going to  be dismissed. I was absolutely thrilled. How could this happen? I was caught dead to  rights! Two days later I received a phone call and an email from the firm saying that if I  completed a level two CRO, 20 hours of community service, and paid a $600 fine plus  court costs, that all charges were to be dismissed! My entire future was left in the hands  of Attorney Joseph C Kreps, and I couldn't have put it in a better place. I now have no  DUI charges and no open container charges on my record. I'm telling you from  experience, this man and his firm are the absolute best DUI Defense Firm you could  possibly hire for your case. ­ If you have a DUI pending ­ Stop what you're doing ­ Call  this firm. It will be the best call you've ever made.

resp.text:
Brooke:
Thank you so much for removing the false information from your original review.  We don’t want any trouble with you - you know that - but if a review is posted with false information then that is not fair and everyone would agree with that.  We certainly appreciate your comments and your feedback. We always love and enjoy any type of feedback.  We ❤️ public criticism of our firm because it allows others to see how we handle our business and how we respond and most of all, it causes us to step back and fully analyze a problem or situation to see what happened, where we can improve and it gives us a valuable opportunity to reach out to a client who is clearly hurting and offer support in whatever way we can.
We never claim to be perfect and certainly don't want anyone to think that we are perfect.  As you know, Brooke, we did not represent you.  We represented your partner who is going through the immigration process in the United States of America. We take great pride in the knowledge and the experience that we have over the last 15+ years in handling and resolving 13,000+ charges all over the State of Alabama. When I was made aware of these issues, we reached out to you to try to resolve it within hours and on the next business morning 7-18-18.  When we did reach out ASAP, you went on and on and then hung up on us before we could even talk.  We tried to call back to no avail.  I personally tried to call back to no avail.
The first and most important thing that I would like to point out is that BOTH of the actual client’s charges were DISMISSED.  And it wasn’t just a “traffic ticket”.  He had 2 charges one of which was failure to obey police/fireman.  Immigration is a difficult process and who knows how this could have seriously impacted his immigration issues - that process and system is ALWAYS CHANGING as everyone knows… but it shouldn’t impact him now because we got BOTH OF HIS CHARGES DISMISSED 😉!
As to the class that was required of him, we are sorry that his time was taken from him in order to do that - our main concern was and is his immigration status and getting the charges dismissed.  His completing a class while his lawyers worked through issues beyond anyone’s control seems like a small price to pay to continue the long and difficult process of becoming a legal United States 🇺🇸 Citizen.
It is important for anyone reading this to know that we did email you the DISMISSAL disposition of BOTH CHARGES back in March 2018... and heard not a peep out of you until this review surfaced almost 4.5 months later.  It is baffling.  We love deeply and dearly every single one of our clients and their friends and family including your partner and also you, Brooke.  We still love you no matter you might post about us.  This is the truth because our love for our clients and our love and passion for our work and the system is not dependent on how others think or feel about us because we know the truth and our love is our love no matter what - it’s just who we are.
I invite anyone reading this or looking for a lawyer to Google my name (Joseph Kreps) at any time and see all of the great information about me and my law firm and all of the great work that we do throughout the State of Alabama.  I stand by my work and the work of everyone who is on my team.  We love what we do because we love people and we love to help people - it’s why I am alive and why I was put on this earth and called to do this type of work.
Much love to you, Brooke, and your partner.  If you change your mind and desire to speak to me then I am always here and always willing to talk.  If you or any family members need our help again in the future, please let us know as we would be honored to assist and help you with anything that comes up.
Joseph C. Kreps
Alabama Lawyer * Lover of People * Defender of Human Beings

name: EddyGordo21
text:
My mother has been dealing with this law firm for an abundance of years, and her experience has been far from stellar. This place moved three times since she has been their client, and they never informed her until she called them herself because they do not contact her. David, the person with whom she asks to speak, is constantly dodging her because he is always "out of the office" or "with another 'more important' client." I'm sure NONE of those "more important" clients have been as equanimous with them as she has.

David has apparently trained his staff to dodge her as well since she called them, and Alice refused to answer the phone (probably because of caller ID) but when I called, she answered the phone just to place us on hold to retrieve something so minuscule that it took less than 30 seconds to do...

Apparently this lawyer and his team care nothing about their clients--and dare I say clients of color... But this is the behavior that is typical of many businesses in the north central region of Alabama. Once the better business bureau is contacted, however, maybe they will change their tone.

If she had not contacted the actual courthouse to get her court date, she would not have even known of the impending court date. After calling these people several times, they refused to give her any of her case details.

So with regard to the other negative review this institution has received, I do NOT agree with the owner that "it is the work of a competitor." I have seen these practices first-hand, and I am far from a capital seeking adversary.

resp.text:
Because we don't recognize your name and you don't appear to be a client of our firm, based off your screen name, there's no way for us to address this issue without knowing the exact name of the client. We also do not have, nor have we ever had, any employees by the name of David or Alice. Are you sure you have the correct firm?

In relation to your comment about "people of color," approximately half of our clients are non-caucasion clients and are "people of color." We have dedicated this firm to representing clients who have been injured, oppressed, overlooked and not been treated fairly, regardless of their designation. Over the years, the lawyers and staff of our firm have also volunteered countless hours of their personal time participating in charities and outreach programs that benefit all segments of our community.

Although we're respectful of your opinion, the assertions you've made about the issue of race are reckless and inaccurate and thats clearly proven by 17 years of close relationships with people of all genders, races and socio-economic statuses that are repeat clients. Many people leaving reviews on this very site are "people of color" and would strongly disagree with your statement and actually take offense to it. Writing a negative review about a business that's never represented you is one thing but making baseless accusations of racial unfairness about people you don't know and who have spent their careers representing underprivileged segments of our state and communities is something else.

If your mother is dissatisfied with any service that any lawyer or staff member of our firm has ever provided, then please have your mother, personally, reach out immediately and ask for the head practice manager so that we can rectify this matter.

We take any client dis-satisfaction very seriously and want every client to be satisfied with our efforts. If your mother is, indeed, a past or current client, then any concerns your mother has will be given our complete attention and we will do our very best to address her concerns.

name: Melanie Daugherty
text: Josh O'Neal is the absolute worst attorney I have ever had. He refuses to return phone calls. He called me ONE TIME during my divorce, the day before the hearing. He never even bothered to send me the final divorce decree. I had no idea what my divorce papers said until his secretary emailed them to me, after the THIRD request. I know all of his secretaries because they are the only ones I could ever talk to. Half the time, they didn't return phone calls either. Halfway through the 'mediation' I got the distinct feeling that he was working for the other side. He obviously thinks he can make a living by gaining clients, screwing them over, and going on to the next victim. He must be too young and immature to grasp the concept that most people will need an attorney more than ONCE in their lifetime, and if he thinks he can be successful without the benefit of repeat clients, he is delusional. If he was the last attorney on earth, I would never hire him again. My divorce is final; I'm still missing half my belongings; he's promised me a refund twice and never delivered. On top of that, he suggested we file a contempt motion because of the fact that I was not given all the belongings I was entitled to. He didn't mention at the time that he planned on charging me an additional $1500 to do what I'd already paid him to do. In my opinion, the reason all his pictures on FB look like gangster photos is because he is a crook. He will stand there and 'listen' to you, but he is just pretending to hear you. You'd have more luck talking to a brick wall. Plus the brick wall might return your calls. I read a bad review of his, and I should have heeded it. If you need a great attorney, contact Michael Haynes.

name: Tracy BrownBeauty
text:
It saddens me to read all of the positive glowing reviews describing the work of Mrs. Shoen to be expeditious, through, responsive and accurate knowing that my family's experience has been nothing short of borderline passive aggressive, unresponsive and non transparent almost from the very beginning. This harrowing experience began for my family and I around the end of August of 2018 when my beloved uncle died unexpectedly. We began paperwork for me to administer estate by which this process has been grossly bumbled through and fumbled 95% of the time. Mrs. Shoen didn't keep my family and I updated as to the status of the case and judges wishes at any point in time. Nor did she even bother to let us know that court dates had been canceled due to heirs requests for extension. Nor did she return our phone calls or emails in a timely manner despite being paid $1000 up front to get started on our case. Then she all of a sudden calls me hurriedly around Thanksgiving black Friday  to request the remaining funds due to be paid which was not in line with our original verbal agreement. I contested her request and the amount was decreased to $228 with the remaining to be paid after estate opening. After this scenario, things all seemed to go downhill rapidly.  Heirs we calling my family with information from probate we had no knowledge of despite having hired Kayla to be our representative which was disheartening and also very stressful. To date we have had 3 canceled court dates on technicality of not having all necessary actions completed prior to court by my attorney. My last court date was June 26 at 2pm by which I spent the entire month or so prior trying to contact Kayla for confirmation and a check in to ensure our readiness to move forward. My calls and texts were not answered and
I never heard anything back from her. Not even a return email was received until the day before the court date. Mrs. Shoen apologized in her email for her gross negligence in handling my uncle's case and said she had closed her practice and that she was withdrawing herself from my case and mailing my case file and a refund check for all money's paid back to me. I spoke with her about this on June 25th. I asked that she send me the USPS confirmation so that I could follow up on the file and refund myself, but she never sent it. Today it is July 5, 2019 and I still have not received anything by mail as promised and also no response to my follow up email...Throughout all this long drawn out process my mom has fallen Ill and lost 40lbs due to stress. To boot, I am dealing with my own distinct stresses in trying to get this estate resolved for my mom because my uncle was her best and only close friend.  I know Kayla may not understand this because it isn't her family or her mom. I understand that Mrs Shoen has been dealing with quiet a few deeply challenging issues of her own here lately and that's why I've been so lenient as I know she is probably still learning how to juggle lifes difficulties simultaneously with lifes obligations and workplace responsibilities. I have compassion for her and truly wish her the best in life but there was left much to be desired from the very minimal level of care attention and concern given to our case. I just wish I would known this before hand as my mom and I have wasted an entire year and still have yet to even get the estate opened. I'm so disappointed, stressed and literally exhausted from this process and dealing with lackadaisical representation has made this process the most cumbersome experience ever. At least when I finally get the file and refund I can move on with my life. I pray and wish I had had the same positive experience as some others have had.

resp.text: Hi Dustin, thank you for the great review. We always put our clients first, and it’s excellent to see that you had a five-star experience with us.

name: Jonathan Lusk
text: As a practicing attorney myself, I was well aware of this law firm's excellent reputation before I selected them to handle a lawsuit on behalf of my family. The firm lived up to its reputation and more.  Attorneys Tim Davis and Mark Ekonen handled our case. They both worked tirelessly all the way through to a successful settlement. My family and I could not be more pleased with their legal expertise and consummate professionalism. Moving forward, I will refer clients to Heninger Garrison Davis without reservation. Take it from an attorney who knows the difference between average and superior legal representation -- if you have been wronged and need a top flight law firm in your corner to achieve the best possible result, contact Heninger Garrison Davis.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words, Jonathan! It means so much coming from a fellow member of the legal community. All the best to you and your family!

name: Jacklyn Stegman
text:
After our bad accident (a semi truck merged into us at 65mph) myself and my mother-in-law were referred to Heninger Garrison Davis as the people who could help us the best. Let me tell you, they were right. The people we worked closest with were Mark,  Eric, and Beverly, and they are all so friendly and helpful.

Even considering that I moved to a different timezone shortly after the accident, I still felt that I was able to easily communicate with them about any questions or concerns I was having (they respond with most efficiency to email in my experience).

During negotiations with the other party (which lets face it, thats the part all of us care about the most) I was shocked by how willing this practice was to work with us and help us obtain the settlement we needed to finally put this ugly event behind us. While I sincerly hope that I am never in another situation that would call for it, I would happily use this law firm again and/or refer them to any friend or family member in need of legal representation.

resp.text: Hi Jacklyn, thank you for leaving us a great review. We’re here to give our clients the best representation and it’s fantastic to hear that you received top-quality legal support.

name: Lisa Jones
text: I truly had a pleasant experience working with Anna. This was a very sensitive matter for me & my first legal issue. Anna came highly recommended to me, and I would recommend her to someone else. I really appreciate you representing me.

resp.text: Thank you for your recommendation, Lisa! We are lucky to have clients like you and want to do everything we can to support you and get the outcome you deserve!

text: Erik persevered and kept me updated through a process where an insurance company tried to draw things out as long as possible. I would highly recommend Erik and his team to anyone who has a need in this area.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Kam! Communication is a top priority when it comes to serving our clients at HGD.

Especially during the current COVID environment and with the courts being backed up it was great to see this Firm adapt to the current situation and get our case settled.

resp.text: Hi Matt, thank you for leaving us a great review! We’re here to give our clients the best representation and we are honored to have been able to work with you and your family.

Our contacts are busy doing all the leg work, representing other clients in court, etc. They are professional, keep you informed, and answer your questions quickly and honestly to the best of their ability. I plan on writing another review down the line as our case proceeds through the judicial system.

Dear Stephen,

Thank you for taking time to post a review for us. We are sorry to hear that your experience was not what you expected. We set a high standard for ourselves and we’re so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our business. We do pride ourselves on our clear communication and full disclosure of all fees at the beginning of any client relationship. For that reason, we would like the opportunity to talk with you and investigate your feedback further. Please feel free to reach out to me directly at 205-327-9121 at your convenience so we may discuss how to possibly resolve your issues. Thanks again.

T. Gauldin – Firm Admin

name: Raven McWilliams
text:
I had the pleasure of working with Dell Cross and Justin Smith. They were everything that I was seeking for an attorney. Before choosing Cross & Smith, the insurance company was offering me mere pennies. They were really taking advantage of me not understanding the process of a personal injury claim. I would ask them questions and it was obvious that they were withholding information from me. They were pressuring me to settle without an attorney. I could tell they were trying to intimidate me.

I chose Cross & Smith and was awarded "10x" the offer the insurance company originally offered me. It was more than I imagined and more than what I would have settled for, if I had to do it alone.

There were no surprises, no hidden fees, they explained everything every step of the way. I would also like to give a special thanks to Leslie Bradley. Leslie kept me updated through phone conversations and emails. Their staff offers nothing but warm hospitality. I was treated as an individual, not a mere client.

It was an extremely fast process, when compared to other people's testimony.  I couldn't have asked for better. I HIGHLY recommend choosing Cross & Smith if you have a personal injury claim!

name: Shane Weaver
text: I was injured in an accident and I chose Justin Smith to handle my case.  I worked with every staff member there by the end of the ordeal and was treated like family but also with true professionalism.  They worked diligently on my case and never faltered or backed down regardless of the obstacles.  I am so happy with the outcome and highly, highly recommend Cross & Smith, LLC to anyone that needs someone they can trust.

name: Jamie Wyatt, OMT
text: We realize there are many options for representation out there, and we talked with several of the "big names" before finding Cross and Smith. With the others, it felt like we were being bullied, in a tank with hungry sharks. We are still receiving junk mail from some. We are SO thankful we were referred to Justin Smith (Cross and Smith) for our accident claim. He and his team were absolutely amazing. They made us feel more like family and less like a case number. We have been very inquisitive during the process and they have handled us with patients and professionalism. They worked diligently to process our claim and their work is greatly appreciated.

name: Alice Kirkland
text: Last year when my husband was injured in a car accident, I contacted Dell Cross. Immediately he and his wonderful staff went to work gathering all the information necessary to settle our claim.  He explained every process, kept us informed and handled everything from the insurance companies down to the smallest bill. He made himself available to us anytime day or night, answering our questions and dealing with our concerns.  Throughout this process, I soon learned, that no one should ever deal with these matters on their own; and I am very grateful to Dell and Leslie for all their hard work.  I don’t know what we would have done without them.

name: jaimie copeland
text: My father-in-law was involved in a horrible traffic accident.  The firm was great at handling all of his questions.  In the end they got him a great settlement, but the thing he remembers most is that the people at the law firm cared about him as a person.  I would highly recommend them to anyone in need of legal services.

name: Eduardo Briseño
text: This law firm is a joy to work with. They are responsive and caring. If you have a personal injury or accident case, contact Cross and Smith, LLC. I highly recommend these attorneys.

name: Robert Upchurch
text: I highly recommend Cross & Smith. They are an excellent law firm with attorneys who care greatly about the individuals they are representing.

name: Josh Firth
text: Some of the finest attorneys I know. Honest, hard workers and will not rest until the job is done. They know their business and will make it their business to know yours and represent you to the fullest.

We have never done any legal work for you, and you have never even spoken to any of our attorneys. Therefore, we request that you remove your negative review of our firm. We hope that you find an attorney that can help you with your legal issue and we are happy to provide you with a few recommendations.

text: Kathryn Gentle has been a great asset during my sons divorce. She has been easy to reach for questions or problems. She is very caring and concerned about my grandsons well being. She has gone above and beyond from the beginning. I would highly recommend her to anyone looking for a capable divorce attorney.

name: H DeLay
text: I hired Lloyd & Hogan for a personal injury after being hit by a drunk driver. The folks I dealt with failed to honor their word. Do not take anything said in conversation as truth. Have ALL correspondence done in writing. Agreements we made over the phone were later denied. They agreed to an even split because they could not get more or refused to continue the case. Also, they continually urged me to settle the case for less than what I should have received. I am left with nerve damage in my neck, which causes tremmors in my right hand. The fiirm made out well.

name: Anon 23
text: If possible, I'd give this firm negative stars. I STRONGLY advise you choose a different firm to represent you. They are a very poor excuse for attorney's. They don't care about you as a person or a case and will not devote the attention deserved. I talked to other lawyers in hopes to fire the one I had in this firm and regret every single day for not doing it. The small cost I would have had to pay to switch lawyers at the point I was at in my case would have been worth it because the rest of my life is affected due to the lack of concern and legal advice provided. If I could keep even one person from having been poorly represented by these people it would be worth it. Don't make the mistake I made. Hire Alexander Shunnarah before you throw your case away with Lloyd and Hogan.

resp.text: Anon 23, are sorry that you did not have a good experience with our firm. We have checked our records and do not see any files under your name, but we appreciate you bringing this experience to our attention. If you are willing, please contact us at 205-969-6235 so we can work towards a resolution. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Tracy Causey
text:
DO NOT USE THIS FIRM!!!!

My brother hired Lloyd and Hogan in Birmingham for help with his disability.   He can never talk to anyone and leaving a message is a joke!  His wife has done all the leg work on this case.  He has been diagnosed with Stage 4 Cancer and when his wife finally spoke with his case worker, she was told his court date for February 2019 could not be moved up!!!  OMG...praying he makes it to February.
DO NOT USE THIS FIRM!!!!!

resp.text: Ms. Causey, I am sorry that you have these feelings, but following the receipt of your review we have spoken with your brother and his wife, who we actually represent, and they do not share your feelings. I suggest you speak with them, and if they have any issues they are of course welcome to contact us to discuss. However, according to our clients, they are very satisfied with our services, as well as the timeliness of services provided and the work ethic of all involved in the handling of their case.

name: Trea Melville
text:
They represented my children for an airbag deployment incident that happened at an impound lot which got a settlement for my kids really think it should have been more and I feel they knew they could get an easy win for them but when it came to me they did not want to bother with the hassle of actually having to fight a case that was a little more difficult because the impound lot owner in Calhoun County that committed the incident by slamming my driver door which deployed airbag on me and my kids which also totaled out my truck making me a victim as well there's no reason why I should be compensated as well.
However since the impound owner works with the Calhoun County courthouses and Sheriff's the magistrates at Calhoun County Courthouse would not let me swear a warrant on the owner of the impound lot but then all of a sudden after getting a small claims paperwork to file against them I suddenly have a warrant for assault charges when I never assaulted anybody court systems there would not even allow me to call my Witnesses that would prove that he is a liar and proved that the Calhoun County Court System is unjust but since supposedly I got in a fight with the owner which I never did I only was defending myself and never threw any punches only foul language however they would not represent me for the case

name: Pat Foley
text:
Abbey Clarkson represented me yesterday on a SS Disability appeal. We haven't received the final judgement but either way I couldn't have asked for better representation. She was organized, precise and understood the proceedure in a way I never could. The judge respected her and her preparedness. I am very pleased with the case we were able to present. ***** five stars all around.

An update.........we won the case. Abbey has  recently started her own firm and I couldn't be more happy for her. Many thanks Abbey Clarkson !!!

resp.text: Thanks so much, Pat! I was my pleasure to represent you. - Abbey

I paid the balance in full (it wasn't cheap but worth it) & received my receipt & satisfaction of judgment letter in the mail a few days later!

The lady Ginger who does the collections is amazingly nice. I feel so comfortable now getting my issues resolved. I will make sure they are the first debt collector I pay.

name: Shameecka Sharpe
text: I work in a customer service driven industry, I’m a Registered Nurse. I go the extra mile every single day, not because I’m required to but because I have empathy and compassion. This office contacted me after I sent a Cashiers Check via Fed Ex to their establishment on a Monday. Today is Friday, I’ve left several voicemails on several different answering machines, not one single person has returned a call, NO RESOLUTION. I never leave reviews, however I’ve never experienced worse customer service. I will now have to write the judge because they couldn’t take five minutes out of their day to go the Extra mile. As I write this review I sit and I reflect on the living that was very close to death, had I not gone the EXTRA MILE. I hope to GOD, in your future someone goes the EXTRA MILE for you or your loved one.

Yelling, threatening, or rude irrational comments does not make debt vanish. However, it does upset the individual in debt. text:
I have known Inge for several years, beginning when he helped my sister with insurance claims regarding her illness.  He was compassionate and kind, meeting with her and encouraging her and working hard to reach a successful settlement.

When I was in need of an attorney after being injured in a car accident, I called on Inge. It was during those months when he was working on my case that I came to know him as a resourceful, tireless advocate and also as a friend. He was always accessible whenever I had a question, always interested in how I was feeling. He was able to obtain a settlement for me that was much more than I had anticipated.

Recently, my elderly dad needed some legal advice.  Again, I sought Inge's help. He took time out of his busy day to talk to us and tell us how to proceed with the issue.

I believe these are the reasons that Inge Johnstone is an effective and successful attorney.  He is a compassionate, kind advocate who is never too busy to take the time to listen to his clients, who he treats as friends.
He then uses his considerable talents as a knowledgeable, resourceful, experienced attorney to work tirelessly to obtain the best possible judgements for his clients.

I highly recommend Johnstone Carroll for anyone who requires legal representation.

name: Hanna Patterson
text:
Had no complaints at first. Not from Alabama, never been in trouble. Never needed an attorney. Got a “drug paraphernalia” charge for a grinder/pipe 🙄 coming home from Florida vacay. They called back in a timely manner, lowered the fee of one bc we were a “package deal” in which I very appreciate HOWEVER he changed my “defendents statement” after we had already signed. Including information that was false and incorrect. He was a solid 30 minutes late for court. So after having falsified court documents, I called him to get them changed or corrected and his response was that the DA needed what the paraphernalia was so “maybe he should have ran it by us”, it didn’t matter, he couldn’t do anything, and the judge already signed off on it. Then upon exiting the court offered to walk us out just to ask for a review on Google. He was pretty easy to talk to, which was the only thing I had to really say until I saw my falsified documents.

‼️UPDATE‼️: MISUNDERSTANDING WAS CORRECTED AND BRIAN MADE SURE THE DOCUMENTS WERE CORRECTED ON BOTH ENDS AND CONTACTED ME IMMEDIATELY WITH FILED/APPROVED CORRECTIONS. I highly recommend using his services! ‼️UPDATE‼️

resp.text: Thank you Hanna. I assure you I had no intent to falsify anything. It was an honest mistake and I’m happy I could help get everything straightened out for you. Best wishes!

text: Just a whole mess. Any works for you before the judge never answer calls, reply via email, send paperwork in. Speak for you

name: Frank Page
text: In 2012 Mr Dasinger was court appointed to me in a criminal case, I never once met with him,spoke to him, nothing until my court date. I wrote many letters, and my family made many calls to no response. The day of court, he had no idea who I was or anything about my case. All he had to say was the state is sending you to prison and to accept it cause that was my only option. I was young, scared, and had no idea what to do. He on the other hand, played on fb, laughed it up with the states attorney, and my victim. My first and only felony, poss of forged instrument, two checks for less than $50, got me 3 yrs. I got more help from the inmates sitting next to me that day than I got from him. He did NOTHING in my deffense. I do honestly believe the outcome would have been less severe if I had paid him cash, or if I had went with a diffrent lawyer. It has been many years and I do hope he has grown as a lawyer and person since then, but I would not recommend him.

resp.text: Unfortunately, when I held a contract with the State of Alabama as an appointed attorney, I did not have the time to meet with all of the 100+ new clients that I was appointed to represent each month. The numbers were simply overwhelming and impossible to keep up with.  I have not handled court appointed work since 2013 because I wanted to be able to give more personal attention to all of my clients, which I am now able to do.  I'm deeply sorry that I couldn't have helped you more Frank.  I hope all is going well and I wish you a prosperous 2019.

name: Lewis McCluer
text: I'm involved in a landlord-tenant dispute and realized I was over my head and needed help. I contacted the Powell Law Firm and got a consultation with Thomas that day. He was very attentive and professional and let me know my options in plain, no nonsense terms. He also let me know that the firm was always available should the matter get to the point that representation became necessary. When I had further questions as the situation progressed, I called back, but was unable to reach Thomas immediately, as he was in court that day. I left a message with their front desk,  and received a call back from Melvin later that day as Thomas was still in court. He listened intently and further advised me as what I needed to do, and even returned another call in regards to my issue. Both Thomas and Melvin were extremely helpful in what was to me new territory as I had never been in a situation like this before. They stood ready to assist any way they could to include retaining their services should the need arise. As a retired Marine with 26 years service I know professionalism when I see it. name: Lisa Edwards
text: I had a 10am appointment to see Mr. Thomas today. It was the worst meeting i have ever had with this company. The young lady at the front desk was more interested in talking to her friend on the phone then greating me when i walked in. after standing there for a few minutes i was told to go have a seat in another room to wait again. as I'm waiting i can hear Mr. Thomas instructing another young associate to go and tell someone to do something and make sure they get it done because that was his money. I'm pretty sure that conversation should not have been discussed in front of a potential client. As I am sitting there explaining to Mr. Thomas why I am there seeking hes services he was more interested in picking the sores on his leg then paying any attention to anything i had to say, and while he was showing me the bruises from his recent jet ski accident all he could tell me was to seek an attorney immediately. I believe that's what I am here. What he ment was i needed a court appointed attorney because I could not afford him. So with Very unprofessional! My family has dealt with Powell Law firm for many years my aunt has know Mr. Thomas sence hes graduation year in 07. They have been wonderful people always willing to help with a smile. till now. So with no help from Mr. Thomas all I can do now is sit back and hope a friend doesn't pass away in lockup because she has a rare condition that causes her to have seizures. I am so disappointed in the actions of Mr. Thomas and the rudeness of the employees at Powell Law Firm.

name: Caleb Crager
text: My name is Caleb Crager.I am from Chatom AL.I was injured in an oilfield accident in Oklahoma last Halloween.Since the injury I was never fully able to recover and as time went by I wasn’t aware of the extent of my injury.In turn I suffered from a tbi.Suffering from such an injury is very difficult to explain when Drs may not be able to pinpoint or fully diagnose the actual root of the problem.I was pushed to the side by my employer and from the negligence on their part I felt is was time to seek legal assistance.I spoke with Mr. Ed Massey over the phone and I gave him a brief summary of my situation.Without hesitation he asked to set up a meeting to get more information.Mr. Ed’s concern was first and foremost my health and getting me properly treated.You will not find a more honest man that will hear you out and truly believe in you and what you have to say.Since my employer was out of Texas I would have to find an attorney from that state.Regardless of that Mr. Ed knowing he had nothing to gain from my case has stood by my side and he was able to find me an attorney to take my case.I know Ed and his son would be there for me day or night to assist me anyway they could.My experience with Ed and his son could not have been more professional.I’m thankful to have the privilege to have met Ed and his son Eddie.They were absolutely wonderful.

name: Melania Escada
text: YOU HAVE TO HAVE THIS LAWYER. Read the reviews. They are real. Personally, I don't know where I would be without Elizabeth Zwiebel being my divorce lawyer. My case started with me being served papers that said my former husband wanted custody of our children. Out of the blue. Without warning I was forced to fight for my children. I could not believe what I was reading. I have always been the full time caregiver for my children. It was astounding to read the words on that paper. Elizabeth greeted me with open arms and understanding words. She explained to me how to best proceed. Her rates were very reasonable especially since I had to hire her on the spot for a hearing in 3 days. She was fantastic in the court room.  Her command of the facts and her preparation was absolutely evident. She knew every detail. She used every bit of the information I gave her to win my case. Without her I don't know where I would be - probably without my children. It was very overwhelming. Her retainer was a no brainer. My family helped me but it was worth every penny. My former husband was way too confident which worked on every single nerve in my body. She told me what was going to happen and every single thing she said happened. It was great to see her work. She stopped the other attorney from running all over me. She straightened out each lie. She worked methodically to get the truth out. I highly recommend her and her team. I would not be where I am without her. Elizabeth, I hope you see this. I cannot thank you enough. From the bottom of my heart - THANK YOU.

resp.text: Thank you Mel. It was a pleasure to work along side you during your case. I work very hard at giving my best to my clients. It makes me very happy when my clients win. I know the stress they feel.  I don't sleep when my clients don't sleep. I worry when they worry. I take it ALL personally. I don't rest until I have done everything I can to make it better for my clients. It was truly a pleasure to work with you and for you.

name: Emily Willoughby
text:
I have used Elizabeth and her team twice over the past 8 years for custody issues.  Most recently this summer she helped with my son who wanted to live with me in Florida.  Elizabeth worked with my family and I for over 3 months to ensure we did everything the law would allow to give us the best chance at relocation for my son. The end result was she was able to ensure my son was able to speak to the Judge, our side of the story was heard, and we were awarded custody last week.  Elizabeth always kept me informed of the case and offered no promises, but told me exactly what to expect and not what I wanted to hear. Her up front and honest approach kept everything clear and helped relieve stress during this difficult summer. Any time I needed a to call or email a question I had responses within the same day or 24 hours. Roxana, the office manager, was amazing at organizing documents for my case and keeping me informed of absolutely everything.  They are an amazing team!

I would recommend the Zwiebel Law Firm to anyone, especially fathers who are fighting for their children.  She went above and beyond to ensure my side of the story was heard, and she helped bring peace to myself and my family.  I could never thank her enough!  - Josh Willoughby

text: The staff at the Zwiebel Law Firm are so awesome! They got me in right away to see Elizabeth. I hired her as my attorney immediately. I went to the office thinking I was defeated in every way. My husband had beaten me in every court hearing I had attended before I got Elizabeth on board. She had a very uncanny way of getting the Judge to change her mind and listen to me for a change. I got the results I had been praying for every night before meeting Elizabeth and her staff. It was truly a miracle. Everyone at the Zwiebel Law Firm returned my calls and responded to my emails quickly. I even got to enjoy texting with Elizabeth while she was in court on other matters. No matter my emergency or issue at hand, I got answers quickly. She never turned me away. She never thought any issue was too small or too big. She stayed with me through it all. She talked to me so sweetly and kindly that it calmed me down each day. I had never been through divorce before and this was new to me. She understood that. She explained every detail before it happened and she was right 100% of the time. She predicted what would happen and we worked my case like a chess game and won. She showed me how to use every avenue to explore ways to settle but also to make a better case for me. I am so glad I decided to change attorneys in the middle of a case. My child would never be the same without our current custody agreement. If she had not fought for me, I would not have alimony or child support to help me and my child through the difficult times. With her help I was able to find a way to get my child in a better home, better school and afford it all with my alimony and child support.  I am so thankful for her and her staff. Words cannot say enough. Hire her today. You will not regret it ever!

name: Cindy Lineman
text: Child custody is so important and so worth hiring the right person. If I had not hired Elizabeth when I did, I would not be sitting in such a sweet spot today. My child was in a terrible custody arrangement with my ex husband. He was stressed, he was sick all the time, he was anxious every day. She turned all that around for my child. She listened to me and took everything I had to say seriously. She took my case and turned it around for my child's sake. My child needed a voice and she made sure and get a lawyer appointed to represent his needs. She took time to take every call. She took time to respond to every email. She would even answer emails late at night. She didn't mind me asking questions any time of day. She took my case and made my child's life better for doing it. She made the judge and the other attorney understand that my child needed a different schedule.  I am so glad that he is not suffering anymore.  I am so thankful and will be forever thankful that she took the time to resolve our problem in the best possible way. We will never forget her or her staff for the courteous way they helped me.

name: Victoria Waters
text: Elizabeth made my uncontested divorce go so smooth. My ex and I were able to come to an agreement in our divorce without feeling pressured and even agreed to have joint custody of our children. Elizabeth answered all our questions and provided great legal services. Call and set up a consultation with Elizabeth you wont regret it.

name: Jenifer
text:
Elizabeth handled my divorce case.  After consulting with eight other attorneys, she was clearly the attorney I knew would put me first and fight for me as if I were family or a close friend.  She has amazing empathy and compassion, two very important things as my ex husband had abandoned me after 25 years of marriage.
She was incredibly professional and amazing in all court appearances including my trial.  Everything she predicted I would get in the divorce came to full fruition.  Every other attorney I consulted with told me I would not keep my home, or receive any of the things Elizabeth was able to secure for me.
She is an amazing attorney and I would recommend her to anyone facing divorce.  It is a devastating thing to experience and Elizabeth has the legal expertise, empathy and compassion to get you through with amazing results.  Without her as my attorney I would not be in the incredibly positive position I am now.
Thank you Elizabeth!

name: Amelia Santos
text: The Zwiebel Law Firm IS THE BEST FIRM!!! Elizabeth and her staff are AMAZING!! When I went to her office I was very upset because my child had been taken away and her staff quickly came to my aid and helped calm me down and even help my mother who only speaks Spanish fill out the paperwork for me because I was so upset. Elizabeth proved that all allegations were false and I was able to get my child back. I am forever grateful to Elizabeth and her staff. I highly recommend Elizabeth Zwiebel.

name: Terri Redmon
text: I never write reviews and I have found myself writing 2 reviews this week. I had an appointment with a divorce lawyer at the Zwiebel Law Firm. Elizabeth Zwiebel was amazing. Her staff really welcomed me. I had a whole notebook of things I needed to tell her. I felt like no one would take the time to listen to me and she NEVER stopped listening, taking notes and giving legal advice on each item I discussed. I really felt like she knew what I was going through. She knows the law and especially divorce law. I met with other attorneys who rushed me through the meeting and didn't know half of the law that she did. She even called me later to let me know of a new law that applied to my special situation. She knew that alimony was not taxable to me. She new that child support was not taxable and was also incorrectly calculated in my last order. She knew that my children needed a stable environment. She knew that I was able to ask for 50% of retirement funds we had saved during our long marriage. She knew that the judge would give me all that and more. She knew that I could straighten out a terrible situation. I was so glad that I decided change attorneys and go with the winner. I can honestly say this prompted me to write a review. I want everyone to know that there is a wonderful attorney out there and Elizabeth Zwiebel is it.

name: Laura Hossman
text: CALL THIS LAWYER! I highly recommend her services. She took a disastrous situation and turned it into GOLD! I thought I was screwed when my husband told me he wanted a divorce. He told me I would get nothing and he would destroy everything. I hired Elizabeth and she turned my whole world around. She worked tirelessly to get protection orders. She answered every call and email I sent, no matter the time of day. She got me money I thought I would never see. She got me health insurance, life insurance and anything I asked for in my divorce. She took a terrible life changing event and made it possible for me to live well. I had another lawyer before her who tried to convince me to settle for less. I hired Elizabeth and she promised what she could do and delivered on every promise. She was up front with me on my case and asked me to follow her every advice. I did just that. Now I am on top of the world. I shutter to think what would have happened if I didn't hire Elizabeth. If I would have settled for what my prior lawyer asked to me to do, I would be in a poor house.

Elizabeth and her staff were the light at the end of a really dark and lonely tunnel. She helped me to get everything I deserved and more. I would recommend them to anyone going through a rough time, like I was. I cannot thank them enough for everything they did for me.

She is absolutely dedicated to her clients, and beyond knowledgable in the current Alabama divorce laws. It's so important to mention,  for anyone divorcing a person with a narcissistic personality, or you feel little hope, Elizabeth is absolutely a top notch. If you are considering hiring attorney, get her before your previous significant other does. My ex absolutely hates her and I love it! When she starts to think about doing something to impact me or my kids you bet she is thinking what Beth will do.

With that being said I have had several issues since our court case and Beth still has answered my questions and been there for me to advise me. If I am forced to go back to court I will be utilizing her and her law firm again.

We did not know who to go to, which one to choose, having consultation after consultation,  praying that we would find a lawyer who COULD help us, who WOULD help us, who CARED about our situation, and choosing Mrs. Elizabeth - she DID help us.
If you are searching on the internet for the best attorney, search no more.  Let this review help you.
When I write these next few lines, try to visualize yourself with your family surrounded by bullets firing, and you were so scared because you knew this was going to be the last time you will ever see your loved ones and your holding on for dear life and praying ‘God help us’ and then someone appeared, and that person got wounded while trying to save you and that person kept on fighting the enemy until the enemy was gone...  that person, that hero, that angel was Mrs. Elizabeth Zwiebel.
We love you and hope your journey is filled with many blessings and wish you and your firm continued success.  Thank You

text:
Well to be honest I did not have much hope when I was served with divorce papers.  I was always heavily involved in my children's lives but saw that it might change for the worst after that day. At each point in my case, we were always ready to make it a final resolution and keeping my goals in mind.  She was always available to answer any question.  I paid good money and got great attention.  She stayed on top of her job.  She mentioned that she "worked" for me and I was the boss.  I liked that about her.  She would always explain the legal process with my goals in mind and keep my eye on the ball.  I am so glad that I found her when I needed a divorce lawyer.

Update:  Almost a year later, I needed help and called Elizabeth.  She took my call and readily gave me the help I needed.  She was still familiar with every fact in my case to this day.  My goodness the memory that she has is amazing.  She walked me through each issue I am currently having and found a solution that worked without going back to court.  I am so thankful I went with her firm in the first place.  If I had gone elsewhere, I would be facing a new legal case today.  Her staff was friendly.  They understood I was under a tremendous amount of stress with my new issue.  Elizabeth quickly picked up the phone.  She gave me the most current law that applied to my problem.  It was such a relief to know that she is always on my side.  She walked me through how to get my problem worked out.  The people at her firm are amazing at problem solving.

It’s been several months. I’m just sick of it. Also my son has tried to reach the person, that he was told to contact, but she never replies. He is trying to collect on his deceased father. I guess they don’t want him to collect his fathers estate. I wish someone would do something. I frankly, don’t know what to do. I intend to report them to BBB, and Bar Association.

resp.text: Mr Cockrell, i still see payment is pending and being processed, that is not on our end at all, we are also waiting and sending numerous emails about payments. Please keep in mind that if you do not get paid we do not get paid. We are doing everything we can, sometimes it takes them a really long time :(.

name: Sherry Sharp
text:
I opened my deceased father's estate on the advice of ELG in order to receive benefits from his asbestosis claim I mailed them letters testamentary. I called ELG on a regular basis to check on status of claim. I was always told that there was an estate issue. Now, time has run out because my fathers estate has been closed, and ELG has claimed the right to administer the estate ad litem, and the processing of the estate has moved from Jefferson to Baldwin County.

I should have never spent the money, which I need, to open my dad's estate only to be ignored long enough for his estate to be closed. Seems there is no way to win with this group without paying/losing more money. My father would be so saddened to know that these benefits are not available to me. He died 3 1/2 years, and I have done all the right things, according to ELG. I guess if they ignore cases long enough, then they can step in, claim that there is no family representative, and take their cut. I think it is a racket.

resp.text: Hello Mrs Sharp,  I see payment is being processed by the asbestos trust funds. Please be patient we are close, we just need to wait for them to process the entire once and for all. Bare with us.
